page.title: 05Employment in Sedlescombe
page.content: The number of people employed within this area is steadily decreasing with changes in agricultural methods and the closing down of small industries. There is a seasonal rise in the numbers employed on the farms as the fruit ripens, and this is usually women and students. Many people from the village commute to Hastings, Battle, Bexhill, London, Tunbridge Wells and Eastbourne. A few local firms attract workers from Sedlescombe and Whatlington as well as from further afield. These include local builders, light engineering, garages, a charcoal burners and a swimming pool builders. The few local shops generally employ local people. Local hotels and restaurants bring in outside workers as well as calling on local casual labour.
